content.body: all AOs do, though, of any stripe
* all AOs do, though, including SDOs and host-defined AOs and so on

m.new_content.body: all AOs do, though, including SDOs and host-defined AOs and so on

content.body: what about all static semantics that also have aoids?
i classified all the the `type="sdo"` into `type="static sdo"` vs `type="dynamic sdo"`, since i need that info to stop propagating the can-call-user-code annotation
content.formatted_body: i classified all the the type="sdo" into type="static sdo" vs type="dynamic sdo", since i need that info to stop propagating the can-call-user-code annotation

content.body: but that only works if we already exhaustively marked the SDOs
I believe we have exhaustively marked the SDOs, yes
SDOs have AOIDs still only because they do not yet have structured headers, since we just wanted to get that PR landed
